result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Larry J Melchert appeared by video, in custody from Redgrantie Correctional Institution.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Larry J Melchert.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. State believes will be a waiver. Attorney Svehlek agrees and has filed waiver. Melchert agrees. Court goes over the waiver of PH with the defendant, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to PH, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information has been filed in April. Svehlek waives reading of information, enters NG pleas to all counts and also notes to the court that she has filed a speedy trial demand. Court continues bond and has set for jury trial.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
and Certificate of Appearance - TR

Court continues bond, considers time limits waived, sets for PH on 9/26/22 at 10:30 AM, defendant will appear via video from Red Granite Correctional Institute.

09:05 AM Defendant Larry J Melchert appears by video from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by video. CC and CR appear by video. Melchert does not have a copy of the complaint but the state will be sending a copy over to him at the jail today. Court reads charges and penalties. Melchert understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Melchert indicates his family is trying to contact an attorney for him, he is unsure of who they are working with. Court has AIA set for 3/2/22 at 11:30 PM and continues bond.
